bibl.title: The Murder of Hypatia: Acceptable or Unacceptable Violence?
Violence in Late Antiquity. Perceptions and Practices
bibl.author: WATTS, Edward

bibl.note: The murder of the pagan philosopher Hypatia (near the end of Lent in 415) was one of the final acts in a power struggle that pitted Cyril, the bishop of Alexandria, against Orestes, the prefect of Egypt.
WATTS Edward, The Murder of Hypatia: Acceptable or Unacceptable Violence?
H.A. DRAKE (Ed.), Violence in Late Antiquity. Perceptions and Practices (Burlington, VT - Aldershot, 2006) pp. 333-342.
